nodes.bodyText: Why is case 0 being removed here?
Because the double is always initialized in the switch statement (there's a default case).
I'd feel more comfortable knowing this was tested. Make sure that percentage increasing is used as well.
This is logically equivalent to the previous code only changes that were made were for the propose of code clarity.
I'd feel more comfortable knowing this was tested. Make sure that percentage increasing is used as well.
As mentioned above this is logically equivalent. The code was just inlined.
Yes, this PR doesn't have the "i tested this" checkbox checked is all.
I don't know why this continue was removed. Would this not end up making each assistant mayor until the last one is finally made mayor?

The readability of the for-loop is difficult because the brackets are missing from them (should add the brackets around the for-loop), but the continue was redundant as the try-catch block is the only thing executed in the loop. Applies for the same comment below.
The continue was probably a typo (or maybe it wasn't at a different time,) and has since been replaced with breaks.
I mean I can add brackets 😄
I don't know why this continue was removed. Would this not end up making each resident mayor until the last one is finally made mayor?
